title: P06-3007

sentences.text: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches .
In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements .
With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events .
With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents .

aliases: With relevant approach, we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents
Entity-with_relevant_approach__we_identi.description: A methodology for identifying important content in an event-based extractive summarization framework using PageRank algorithm and an event map constructed from documents.

summary: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches . In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements . With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events . With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents . Experimental results are encouraging .

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: To investigate means to systematically examine or analyze something (e.g. a phenomenon, an issue, or a concept), often with the goal of gaining deeper understanding, identifying patterns or relationships, and/or uncovering underlying truths.

Predicate-are_defined_as.label: are defined as
Predicate-are_defined_as.description: The predicate 'are defined as' establishes a relationship between two concepts where one (the subject) serves as the foundation or basis for defining another (the object). In this sense, it indicates that the object's meaning or scope is derived from or tied to the characteristics of the subject.

Predicate-associated_with.label: associated with
Predicate-associated_with.description: The predicate 'associated with' indicates a connection between two entities where one entity (the subject) has a relationship or attribute that is characterized by another entity (the object). This relationship can be based on various aspects such as categorization, classification, description, or explanation. The association implies some level of correspondence, similarity, or relevance between the subject and the object.

Predicate-identify_important_contents_by.label: identify important contents by
Predicate-identify_important_contents_by.description: This predicate indicates a method or criterion used to determine what constitutes 'important' content. It establishes a connection between the subject and object by specifying how the important contents are identified, providing context for understanding their significance.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship of utilization or application between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject makes use of, relies on, or employs the object in some way to achieve its purpose or function.

Predicate-is_used_for.label: is used for
Predicate-is_used_for.description: This predicate indicates a functional relationship between its subject and object, suggesting that the subject serves as a means or tool to achieve some purpose or goal represented by the object. In general, it implies a causal connection where the subject is employed or utilized for the benefit of achieving the outcome described in the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or example of a more general category or class represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower term within the scope defined by the object.
